section.description: The Code > Transform command is a very powerful script editing tool for advanced Xbasic programmers. This utility has several built-in functions.

section.title: Transform using an Xbasic Expression
section.description: Transform using an Xbasic Expression lets you use Xbasic to transform a block of code in the Code Editor. For example, assume that the Code Editor contains the following block of code:
section.example: Firstname Lastname Company City State Zip

section.description: You would like to transform the code into the following:
section.example: DIM Firstname as C DIM Lastname as C DIM Company as C DIM City as C DIM State as C DIM Zip as C

step.description: Select the text in the Code Editor.
Select the Transform Code command (from the toolbar, menu, or right-click menu). The Transform Code dialog appears.
Optionally, click the Remove Blank Lines or Sort radio buttons and click OK.
Optionally, enter a transformation expression in the Expression field. For example, enter: "DIM " + x + " as C", where " x " is the placeholder for the text on each line in the selection.
Click OK and the selected text is transformed.
